ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class would be appropriate for a wide range of students - it covered less known works of great Russian writers, so worked as both a deepening of knowledge for those already familiar with the famous works and as an introduction for those as yet unfamiliar. It covered a broad range of genres and media. The instruction was fantastic. I would certainly recommend this class to any student.
Yes, I would recommend this class to other students both as a survey class on Russian realism and as a more specific course on cross-arts research. It was a well-balanced and well-organized seminar.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course was very helpful in deepening my knowledge of my interests - it taught me to work across different media, how to engage with both canonical and more obscure texts; the professors encouragement allowed me to better and more confidently express myself in front of a group of students. I am sure I will use some of what I have learned during my dissertation years.

The course did deepen my knowledge about Russian realism, and was also useful as Professor Brunson brought up a lot of meta commentary on the discipline. The last seminar was a mini-conference with in-class presentations, which was a useful exercise.
